author: Chieftain Brundt
quote: the frozen lands of Acheron are a terrible vicious place. We do not fear the cold but there are things up there that live where no living thing should survive. The stories tell of icy winds with intent so malicious they will wrap themselves around your heart until it freezes like stone
name: Postbag

author: Chieftain Brundt
quote: In good time we will venture north and warm the very winds themselves with our battle cries and song; unlike the scurvy pirates we possess qualities other than fearlessness. We are patient and know the time is not yet right, the dangers of the daggermouths have not been overcome yet and until they have it would be prudent to wait.
Maybe it's the land of Acheron I have heard about.

author: High Priest (Sophanem)
quote: The more antique pyramids were named long ago, when the people of the desert spoke a very different language. ‘Jal' simply means ‘tomb' in this tongue – so it is that we have the ‘Tomb of Kings', the ‘Tomb of the Agile' and the ‘Tomb of Magic'.

author: Akthanakos
quote: I'd love to check in on them, but unfortunately I'm still detained up here in the north, waiting on everyone else – as usual. [...] Luckily I have my age-long epic battle with Enakhra to pass the time. It's going alright.

author: High Priest (Sophanem)
quote: The more antique pyramids were named long ago, when the people of the desert spoke a very different language. 'Jal' simply means 'tomb' in this tongue – so it is that we have the 'Tomb of Kings', the 'Tomb of the Agile' and the 'Tomb of Magic'.

Yes, I have made some quick travels through RuneScape since being freed from my incarceration and I can but concur with you on the poor condition of this world, though I know not why you call it Gielinor. It saddens me that the once great empire is not only gone, but as good as forgotten.
author: Azzanadra
Cam the Camel
quote: I did come across a well-laden camel on one of my journeys through the desert who might meet the description, though. She was carrying piles and piles of books, all about banking! She was saying something about portals and the Devourer, but I’ll be honest – most of it went over my head.

author: Mawnis Burowgar
notes: "We tend to rip from the bone, but a yak patty still whets the appetite. We shall call it a beefburrowgar... actually, that should be a yakburrowgar - oh, and a really big one could be a big yak!"

author: Brassican Mage
notes: “This principle is at the heart of Brassican philosophy – embrace it, and you too may find enlightenment.”

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: There are a few other dwarves in Varlamore, but we haven't been in contact for centuries, on account of all the assassinations and wars and such.

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: Yes, we are in contact with the Mining Consortium. They don't have anything to offer us that we don't make here in Lovakengj.

author: Jonathan
quote: King Agata IV's mismanagement left the kingdom ravaged by famine...

author: Jonathan
quote: Most young men and women were drafted into the houses' personal armies during the war, and Hosidius did not fare well.

author: Jonathan
quote: You do expect a level of chaos following any conflict, but the records show constant disappearances, once or twice a night...

author: Jonathan
quote: ...the records show constant disappearances, once or twice a night for almost a year before they suddenly stop completely. Very odd indeed.

author: Jonathan
quote: One might surmise that the demons were somehow cowed by an even greater power – not anyone I'd like to meet!

author: Reldo
notes: "Now, as you may or may not know, libraries are carefully monitored things, especially after the great fire of ‘86, where one too many books on spontaneous combustion were kept near a rather lively tome on literary sentience."

author: Reldo
notes: "I have only recently managed to properly train one of my assistants in the fine art of book restoration, and I hope that his solitary labours will bring fruit soon (I have to lock him up in the back room - library assistants are very slippery and prone to getting drunk and burning books)."

author: Reldo
notes: "It is for that reason that rules govern how and where we can keep our books."

author: Bryophyta
quote: We keep ourselves to ourselves, we giants. A long time ago we might have worshipped the gods, but not anymore. We do love nature though! Well, we moss giants do, at least.

author: Akila
quote: When the Devourer slaughtered us, I prayed that I might have another chance to help someone put a stop to her evil plans. Perhaps blessed Elidinis answered that prayer, and that’s why I have been allowed to linger on, when so many others have been lost?

author: Santa
quote: It does not cost me much to make so many presents, as we have a deal that I cannot completely reveal to you. All I can say is that when you 'High-Alch', as you call it, some of the material gets a little 'waylaid'.

author: High Priest
quote:
I'm afraid I can offer no positive news. In fact, since that business with the temple, things have only gotten worse.

Menaphos is still refusing to communicate, the plagues show no sign of stopping, and the thralls of The Devourer have gone mysteriously quiet, which is never good news. We've even had reports that a couple of Al Kharidian spies have been spotted lurking about – and if I catch them, the only intelligence they'll be taking home is a detailed report on the sole of my sandal!

I do apologise. Things have been so difficult lately, it's hard not to lose my temper.

author: Alec Kincade
notes: "It's true that the traditional depiction of horses looks a bit like a unicorn, but our research suggests the resemblance is purely superficial."

author: Farmer Fred
notes: "Well, I was at a GAG meeting the other night and I noticed a book called “The woolen horse of Troy” or something like that. Gave me an idea…"

author: Alec Kincade
notes: "Freya has an interesting theory on the subject. She claims to have seen evidence that horses once roamed the wilds of Acheron. If that's true, these creatures may be far more dangerous than your average ungulate."

author: Jerico
notes: "I'll have you know my family have been raising pigeons for the king for years! In wars gone past, our fastest birds were used to carry messages past the enemy to the other settlements, faster than any horse, not that there's any of them left these days. Not round here anyway."

author: Alec Kincade
notes: "We have ourselves dispatched agents to the Karamjan Jungle to keep an eye on Mr Hajedy's… activities, but we are yet to witness these ‘horses' for ourselves. We can only assume it must be some sort of marketing tactic…"

author: Akila
notes: Perhaps blessed Elidinis answered that prayer, and that’s why I have been allowed to linger on, when so many others have been lost? There is another saying among us scholars: don’t look a gift camel in the mouth!

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: There are a few other dwarves in Varlamore, but we haven't been in contact for centuries, on account of all the assassinations and wars and such.

author: High Priest (Sophanem)
quote: The more antique pyramids were named long ago, when the people of the desert spoke a very different language. ‘Jal' simply means ‘tomb' in this tongue – so it is that we have the ‘Tomb of Kings', the ‘Tomb of the Agile' and the ‘Tomb of Magic'.

author: Jonathan
quote: King Agata IV's mismanagement left the kingdom ravaged by famine...

author: High Priest (Sophanem)
quote: These days, we name our tombs after the last person to be buried there, so the other Sophanem pyramid is known as ‘Klenter's Pyramid', and someday, it will be mine.
name: name

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: Oh, Yonrith Lovakengj? He was our founder, you know. He was a great military commander, or so the story goes. Not much talent in Smithing though.

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: Yes, we are in contact with the Mining Consortium. They don't have anything to offer us that we don't make here in Lovakengj.

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: There are a few other dwarves in Varlamore, but we haven't been in contact for centuries, on account of all the assassinations and wars and such.

author: Death
quote: It seems your friend has been doing valuable work in the land of souls. The servants of The Devourer cower in her presence! I imagine that's a great weight off my colleague's shoulders.

author: Ignisia
quote: Our previous Grand Master was my mentor. A brave woman, indeed. One terrible day, she was summoned to a meeting with Xeric. She never returned. I have no doubt that she was loyal to our Order until the last. There was some turmoil – not everyone shared my dedication to the cause – but in the end, I was elected by unanimous vote.

author: Imerominia
quote: Twill was a stronghold somewhere near the centre of Kourend, a place that had been respected as neutral ground since the founding of our nation. The Council of Elders would meet there to discuss matters of import, and as you might imagine, the signing of the Accords was of great import indeed.

author: Imerominia
quote: Sadly we'll never know exactly where Twill stood, although it's safe to surmise its ruins may well have been the foundation for Kingstown.

Rural branches of banks are useful, and we should make full use of them. Otherwise there may come a day when the Bank of RuneScape closes its outlying branches and the Council has them transformed into trendy wine-bars.
author: Dionysius
Armacus
notes: Armacus is a Guardian of Armadyl and describes how Armadyl's army contained Aviansies.

author: General Babacus
quote: The truth is, the Shayzien name carries a lot of weight even overseas. ... To this day, merely mentioning the name ‘Shayzien' opens a lot of doors for us.

author: Azzanadra
quote: Before I was imprisoned there were many of us, the most powerful of which you have named - but do not forget Sliske the serpent-tongued, who delves the shadows, and the impostor Zamorak, who calls himself a god.

author: Kovac
quote: Kovac did not steal it! Kovac not hurt any body, not giant, not dweeb… dwarf. [...] Uh… Kovac get it from giant friend. Not sure where she get it… sure it was all leggy hittimat.

author: Hairdresser Hair-Architect
notes: "Ribbons? Ribbons! Pfft. I can clearly see that you would not make the grade. Even Ridgeley the chinchompa whose efforts power my pole has better taste than you."

author: Tarn
quote: ...there's no such great library in Morytania. Drakan stamped out such knowledge eons ago, lest his peons discover the means to their own liberation. I had to travel across the ocean, to Kourend, and glean whatever information I could...

author: King Roald
quote: Look here, you – there's no need to be rude! Spots might be a little lumpy in places, but I assure you he's not the least bit oversized. And just because he dribbles everywhere and makes that horrible snorting sound doesn't make him a pug. Reldo assures me that he's a pedigree light beast - or er, was it dark beast?

author: Hairdresser Hair-Architect
notes: "Ribbons? Ribbons! Pfft. I can clearly see that you would not make the grade. Even Ridgeley the chinchompa whose efforts power my pole has better taste than you."

author: Akthanakos
quote: Oh, and word to the wise – that's not actually spit, per se. You might just want to buy new robes.

author: Jonathan
quote: King Agata IV's mismanagement left the kingdom ravaged by famine...

author: Jonathan
quote: Most young men and women were drafted into the houses' personal armies during the war, and Hosidius did not fare well.

author: Archmage Sedridor
quote: I had heard of these so-called ‘Wrath Runes', although I didn't know what to make of the rumours. They're not referenced in any of the ancient texts I've studied, so I'll confess until you mentioned them just now, I assumed they were a myth.

author: Makeover Mage
quote: I found it [the amulet] one day after killing a whole nest of gazulibirds (now long extinct). I put the thing on and suddenly my hair grew down to my waist! Further experimentation led to the powers you see today.

author: Makeover Mage
quote: ...people are often remarking how handsome it [the amulet] looks, so I may ask Doric if he can fashion me a few copies. Pop by when you're in my area and I am sure we will be able to strike a deal.

author: Lady Vulcana Lovakengj
quote: Oh, Yonrith Lovakengj? He was our founder, you know. He was a great military commander, or so the story goes. Not much talent in Smithing though.
